docs.title: Release notes
docs.text: GoodCloud platform is committed to providing users with comprehensive and high-quality services. Our team is dedicated to continuously improving and enhancing the user experience to ensure that you have the best possible experience. Thank you for choosing our platform, and we look forward to serving you better in the future.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text: • A new API Integration feature has been added, users can use this feature to call GoodCloud platform interfaces. (Please actively contact us if you would like to try this feature).

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed an occasional pop-up reset problem when users perform an advanced search. It now works correctly.

docs.title: Security Updates
docs.text: • Optimized global rate limiting to improve the security of platform interface calls.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Added a new platform maintenance page, allowing you to know the maintenance and deployment status of the platform on time.
  • Added a new customizable session duration feature. You can set the session expiration time in the VAR/Organization Settings menu bar to avoid the account exit from the platform during operation.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Optimized the display of the Remote Connect button on the Device Details page. You can use the Access Device Terminal and Access Web Admin Panel buttons to remotely access the device.
  • Improved the design of the Brand Customization feature to meet the needs of multi-regional brand customization.
  • Optimized the login logic of entering the security interface to avoid repeated operations by users.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text: • Fixed the Self-view Bound Device interface export function, the table header and device information can be matched properly now.

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text: • Please contact our support team (b2bsupport@gl-inet.com) for more information.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text: • Optimized performance of platform interfaces to improve page loading and response time. We will continue to optimize the responsiveness of the interface in iterative releases to improve your user experience.

    • Added units for values (RSRP, RSSI, RSRQ, and SINR).
    • The display of the Device Details page has been customized, and we will continue to improve the customizability of the page.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Modify Configuration:

    • Enabled deployment to offline devices for improved efficiency.

    • Added a Device Settings Logs module to view details of configuration deployments.

  • OTA Firmware Upgrade:

    • Introduced full monitoring of the firmware upgrade process.

    • Added an Upgrade Logs module for tracking upgrade progress and results.

  • Template Settings:

    • Simplified page operation logic for easier template management.

  • Device Group Details Page:

    • Added Group Configuration feature. Devices added to a group with a configuration will sync automatically.

  • IoT Device Onboarding:

    • Supported IoT device onboarding with Thread network management and BLE Bluetooth scanning/reporting.

  • Develop Online Docs:

    • Added online documentation for B2B customers, including Release Notes, API Integrations, and User Guides.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• UI & UX Optimizations:

    • Refined theme colors and interaction styles for a better user experience.

  • Module and Feature Removal:

    • Task List Removal: Removed the Task List menu; task progress and results are now in the Logs module.

    • Set Preference Removal: Removed from Groups menu; introduced group configuration concept.

  • Device Connection Service Overhaul:

    • Refactored for faster response and increased device concurrency.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Device Status:

    • Added a new device status: Abnormal (e.g., devices requiring re-activate will show as "Abnormal").

    • We recommend selecting the device in this state and reactivating it. If it still fails to come online, contact technical support for troubleshooting.

  • Message Center:

    • Users can now manage messages triggered by user actions, device configurations, and device alerts directly from the Message Center page.

  • Device Logs:

    • New device logs feature that tracks device online/offline status and interactions with the cloud platform, helping users troubleshoot device issues independently.

  • Alert Logs:

    • A new alert log module has been added. Users can view all device alert information within this organization on this page.

    • By default, it is only available to organization administrators. Please be cautious when granting access to members.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• UI & UX Optimizations:

    • Fixed display issues on some browsers to ensure consistent user experience across platforms.

  • Device Notifications:

    • Streamlined the process of creating device alert rules on the platform, allowing users to set multiple alert rules for individual devices to suit various use cases.

    • Improved alert functionality. Use devices with firmware version 4.7.0 or higher for a more complete monitoring experience.

docs.title: Defects Fixed
docs.text:
• Improved performance when using the S2S feature for multi-node networking, reducing timeouts and errors in the cloud.

  • Optimized API performance to enhance the loading speed of device detail pages.

  • Refined VAR Token settings to ensure seamless inheritance of Token configurations when VAR members access sub-organizations, improving support efficiency.

docs.title: Security Updates
docs.text:
• Increased email verification code length to 6 digits for better security.

  • Introduced CAPTCHA verification to reduce malicious API calls and protect the platform.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: • The old version of the mobile app only supports 4-digit verification codes. Please update your app to the latest version to continue using the cloud platform.

  • Timeline:

    • The Timeline module on the device details page has been restructured to provide a visual display of device online and offline status.

  • Support for Accessing Router WEB-GUI via HTTPS:

    • This feature will be supported starting with router firmware version v4.8.0. Stay tuned!

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Device Status:

    • The status 'Abnormal' has been renamed to 'Unsynced' for better clarity.

    • Devices in this state have not synced their actual status to the cloud. We recommend reactivating the device in this state. If it still fails to come online, contact technical support for troubleshooting.

  • OTA Firmware Upgrade:

    • Users can select individual devices or batch devices for OTA firmware upgrades. If a device is offline, the upgrade will take place once the device comes online again.

    • Users can now view the reasons for firmware upgrade failures in the upgrade record details. A manual retry option for failed upgrades has been added to improve user convenience.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Multi-Level VAR Distribution:

    • Introduced multi-tier VAR management, allowing primary VARs to create and manage subordinate VAR accounts.

    • Subordinate VARs can independently create and manage ORG accounts, ensuring smooth inventory integration.

  • Custom Menu Permission Management:

    • Added menu and feature permission settings for VARs, allowing them to assign specific menus to subordinate VARs and ORGs.

  • Device Sharing Across VAR Hierarchy:

    • Enabled device sharing from sub-VARs and sub-ORGs to the primary VAR. A dedicated sharing page has been added for centralized management.

  • Inventory Transfer Tools:

    • Added a feature to transfer devices from main inventory to the appropriate VAR department. Returns are now properly tracked.

docs.title: Feature Enhancements
docs.text:
• Rebuilt VAR/ORG Dashboards:

    • Redesigned the homepage dashboard for VARs and ORGs to include key metrics such as device status, VAR structure overview, distribution activity, organization details, and data analytics.

  • Token Auto-Renewal Enabled by Default:

    • Enabled token renewal by default for VAR and ORG accounts to prevent unexpected logouts during active use.

  • Improved Invitation Email Handling:

    • Optimized error handling and redirection logic when new users open invitation links, improving activation success rates.

  • UI/UX Improvements:

    • Updated multiple frontend interfaces for a more intuitive and user-friendly experience.

  • Refined Error Messages for Device Binding

    • Enhanced error feedback when binding devices to improve troubleshooting accuracy.

  • UI/UX Improvements:

    • Improved layout and interaction design for the device list: removed the “Action” column and reorganized buttons for a cleaner view.

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text:
The GoodCloud platform offers comprehensive services to meet the needs of Organizational and VAR (Value-Added Reseller) customers. With dedicated features and management tools, it ensures an efficient, secure, and easy-to-use experience for both account types.

For Organizational Customers, if you are managing multiple devices or networks under a commercial or enterprise setting, please contact your commercial representative to obtain an organizational account. This account will allow you to access the full suite of GoodCloud platform features.

For VAR (Value-Added Reseller) Customers, your account provides access to device and network management functions within the GoodCloud platform. Contact our commercial team to obtain a VAR account if you haven't already.

Please make sure to consult the corresponding Organizational or VAR interface guide based on your account type for step-by-step instructions on using the platform.

docs.title: 1. Organization and cooperation management
docs.text:
Business background: For business users, there are typically a large number of devices already integrated into the platform that they have purchased.

Additionally, enterprise users may need to add more devices to the platform, which could be located in various locations or belong to different sub-organizations. Different devices may also require management by different sub-administrators.

Therefore, platform administrators can create distinct departments and roles and invite personnel with the appropriate permissions to manage these devices.

docs.title: 1.1. Join the Organization
docs.text:
• If a user has not yet registered for a GoodCloud account, when adding them as an organization administrator or a member, an email invitation to register will be sent to their email address.

    • Once the user clicks on the registration link, they will be automatically enrolled in the organization.

    • Sign up for a GoodCloud account: Visit GoodCloud, sign up, then sign in. If you don't find the verification email, check your spam folder or try again later. If you have any difficulty signing up, please send an email to b2bsupport@gl-inet.com for help.

  • If the user has already registered for a GoodCloud account, when adding the user as an organization administrator, there are two methods for the user to confirm the invitation:

    • Method 1: An invitation email will be sent to the user's email address. By clicking on the link and authorizing it, the user will join the organization, and the page will redirect to the organization's view.

    • Method 2: Once the user logs into GoodCloud, a reminder will pop up on the interface. After clicking 'Accept', the user will join the organization, and the page will redirect to the organization's view.

  • Users who have joined the organization can see the current view status in the upper right corner of the interface and can switch between the organization view and the self-view. Devices and data belonging to individuals are not interoperable with devices and data belonging to organizations.

Note: On the home page, you can view online devices, offline devices, deactivated devices, total number of devices, and departmental status. Click the corresponding view module to quickly jump to the data source.

docs.title: 1.2. Creation of Departments within the Organization
docs.text:
In the Organization view, go to Administration → Departments page.

  • The page displays the hierarchical structure of each department and shows information about each department (department name, members, and number of devices).

    Note: Members within a department can only see devices in their own department and its sub-departments.

  • When the page opens, the primary department (the organization) is automatically selected. Clicking '+ Add' creates a new secondary department.

  • In the pop-up window, enter the name of the department and click 'Confirm' to create the new secondary department.

  • To add departments at different levels to the organization, select the parent department you want to add a sub-level to from the list on the left and repeat the previous steps.

    Note: If the organization requires a more detailed division of authority, it can be divided into up to five levels of departments.

docs.title: 1.3. Inviting Members to Join the Department
docs.text:
In the Organization view, go to the Administration → Members.

  • On the left side of the page is the department tree. On the right side are the action buttons and the list of members in each department. Click the '+ Invite' button to complete the invitation of new members in two steps:

    • Step 1: Enter the email or username of the user you want to invite in the pop-up window, and then check the expiration time of the invitation. Next, click the 'Next' button.

      • Depending on the user information entered in the previous step, the platform performs different actions:

      • If the email address entered is not yet registered, a window will pop up asking whether to invite the user to register. Click 'Confirm' to proceed to the second step. The system will automatically send an email to the user. The user will click the link in the email to enter the registration page and will join the corresponding department after successful registration.

      • If the email address or username entered is already registered, the interface will directly display the corresponding user information.

    • Step 2: In the pop-up window, select the organization role and the department that the member wants to join. The role can be multi-selected. (Note: The actions a member can perform with the device in this department and sub-departments are determined by the role assigned.) Once the role and department selection is complete, click 'Apply' and the system will send an email to the user and wait for their confirmation.

  • Invited members are displayed in the list on the right side of the page, with the Unregistered or Unaccepted status label after the username. Users who click the link in the email to complete the registration or authorization process will join the corresponding department, and the label will be updated. If a user deletes the email or clicks 'Reject' by mistake, they can select the member in the list and click 'Re-Invite' to resend the invitation.

For details about the process for a member to receive an invitation to join an organization, please refer to the steps in 1.1. Join the Organization.

docs.title: 2. Devices Obtain Preconfiguration Information in Batches
docs.text:
Business Background: Certain standard configurations need to be applied to specific models and versions of devices (for example, X3000 4.4). These devices are distributed by the customer to different locations for deployment, and the online time of devices is uncertain.

Therefore, users can create a configuration template and preconfigure the selected devices. Once the devices go online, the preconfigured template is automatically delivered to them.

docs.title: 2.1. Create a Device Group
docs.text:
Under Organization View, go to the Grouping page. The left side of the page displays the department tree. Groups created in the organization must belong to a department. So, first select the department to which the device group will belong from the list on the left.

  • Click the Add button to create a new group.

  • Enter the group name in the pop-up window and select the device model and version (you must add the device before creating the group). You can only add one model and version of the device to each group.

  • Once successfully added, the group will be displayed in the list on the right.

docs.title: 2.2. Adding Devices to a Group
docs.text:
To move devices to a device group, click the left navigation bar to go to the Devices page. Select the devices you want to move and click Manage → Move Group.

Then select the target group in the pop-up window and click Confirm.

You will receive the following prompt:

The number of devices in the corresponding group will increase. At this point, users can batch configure the devices in the device group, just as they would with a single device.

docs.title: 2.3. Creating a Template for Device Settings
docs.text:
In the Organization View, click on the 'Settings Template' menu in the left navigation bar to access the page. The templates configured here can be used on the Devices and Groups pages.

  • The first step is to create a template. Click the 'Add' button to add a new template. Enter the template name in the pop-up window and select the corresponding model and firmware version, then click 'Next'.

  • In the 'Configuration' section on the left side, enter the corresponding information. Then click 'Add'.

  • Preview the configuration information to be issued and click 'OK' or 'Apply'.

  • The list shows the templates you created and what the templates are configured for.

docs.title: 3. Device batch configuration
docs.text:
Business background: Customers may need to update the configuration for multiple devices that are used in the same service scenario and share the same model and firmware version. In such cases, configurations can be delivered in batches using device groups.

  • The previous steps are the same as those outlined in sections 2.1-2.3 for “Devices obtain preconfiguration information in batches.”

  • Navigate to the Group/Device page from the left navigation bar. Select the group or device you wish to configure, then click on Settings → Apply Template.

  • Select the template you configured in the pop-up window, then click Apply.

docs.title: 2. Join the Organization
docs.text:
• If a user has not yet registered for a GoodCloud account, an email invitation will be sent to their address when adding them as an organization administrator. Once the user clicks the registration link, they will be automatically enrolled in the organization.

    • Once the user clicks on the link to register, they will be automatically enrolled in the organization.

    • To sign up for a GoodCloud account: Visit GoodCloud, sign up then sign in. If you don't find the verify email, look in spam or check email later. If you have any difficulty with sign up, please send email to b2bsupport@gl-inet.com for help.

  • If the user has already registered for a GoodCloud account, there are two methods to confirm the invitation:

    • Method 1: An invitation email will be sent. By clicking the link and authorizing it, the user will join the organization, and the page will redirect to the organization's view.

    • Method 2: Upon logging into GoodCloud, a reminder will pop up. Clicking 'Accept' will join the user to the organization and redirect them to the organization's view.

  • Users who have joined the organization can view their status in the upper right corner of the interface and switch between the organization view and the SELF-view. Devices and data are not shared between individual and organizational views.

Note: On the home page, you can view the bound online devices, offline devices, inactive devices, total number of devices, and departmental status, and click the corresponding view module to realize the quick jump of the data source.

docs.title: 3. Creation of departments within the organization
docs.text:
In the Organization view, navigate to the Administration → Departments page.

  • The page displays the hierarchical structure of each department and provides information about each department (department name, members, and number of devices).

Note: Members within a department can only view devices in their own department and its sub-departments.

  • When the page opens, the primary department (the organization) is automatically selected. Click '+ Add' to create a secondary department.

  • In the pop-up window, enter the department name and click 'Confirm' to create the secondary department.

  • To add different levels of departments, re-select the department you want to add a sub-level to from the list on the left and repeat the previous steps. Note that if the organization requires a more detailed division of authority, it can be divided into up to five levels of departments.

docs.title: 4. Create or Modify Organizational Roles
docs.text:
To access the role view status, navigate to Administration → Roles page in the Organization view. The interface will display the current status of the role view.

  • On the left side of the page, you will see a list of roles available for the organization. The organization is created with preset roles, and administrators or members with appropriate permissions can also create new roles as needed. On the right side of the page, the interface displays the actions that can be performed by the currently selected role.

  • To add a new role, click the 'Add a New Role' button in the list. To modify an existing role, select the role and click the 'Edit' button in the bottom right corner of the screen. This will take you to the role editing page where you can make the desired changes.

    ① On the role editing page, you can change the role name by clicking on the field at the top right of the page and entering the new name.

    ② In the right area of the role editing page, you can view a list of all the functional modules available for the organization. You can control the corresponding operation privileges of each role by toggling the buttons beside each module. It is essential to note that all functional modules must have View privileges before you can control other operational privileges for the corresponding module.

  • In addition to toggling individual module privileges, users can also click on "Allow All" or "Close All" in the upper right corner to batch allow or prohibit the corresponding module privileges.

  • Once you have finished configuring the role and made all the desired changes, click the "Apply" button. This will save the changes and return you to the role configuration page.

docs.title: 5. Inviting Members to Join the Department
docs.text:
To access the Member Management page in the Organization view, go to the Administration → Members page.

  • On the left side of the Member Management page, you will see the department tree. On the right side of the page, you will find the action buttons and the list of members in each department. To invite new members, click the '+ Invite' button and follow the two-step process to complete the invitation.

    • Step 1: enter the email address or username of the user you want to invite in the pop-up window. You can also specify the expiration time for the invitation. Once you have entered the relevant details, click the 'Next' button to proceed to the next step.

    • Depending on the user information entered in the previous step, the system performs different actions:

      • If the email address entered is not yet registered, the interface will pop up a window asking whether to invite the user to register. Click the confirmation to enter the second step, and the system will automatically send an email to the user. After receiving the email, the user will click the link in the email to enter the registration page and will be able to join the corresponding department after successful registration.

      • If the entered email address or user name is already registered, the interface will directly display the corresponding user information.

    • To add a member to your organization, follow these steps:

      • In the pop-up window, choose the organization role and the department that the member wants to join. Note that the role can be multi-selected. Please keep in mind that the member's access to the device in this department and sub-departments is determined by the role they have.

      • Once the role and department selection is complete, click 'Apply'. The system will then send an email to the user and wait for their confirmation.

  • Once a member is invited, they will appear in the list on the right side of the page with an "Unregistered" or "Unaccepted" status label next to their username. When the user clicks on the link in the email to complete the registration or authorization process, they will be added to the corresponding department and their label will be updated.

    However, if the user accidentally deletes the email or clicks "Reject" by mistake, they can still join by selecting their name from the list and clicking "Re-Invite". This will resend the invitation email to the user.

docs.title: 6. Adding Devices
docs.text:
To add a device under the Organization view, navigate to the Devices page where the department tree will be displayed on the left side of the page.

For most business customers, devices will be added directly to the top departments, and there will be no need for any additional actions.

1) Before adding a device, make sure to visit the router's admin panel. You need to Enable the Cloud Service.

2) To add a device, follow the steps below: ① You need to select the target department. ② Click the "+ Add Device" button.

There are three ways to bind devices to your GoodCloud account: Auto Discovery, Manual Add, and Bulk Import.

1) Auto discover If your router and PC are on the same network, you can try the Auto Discovery feature. Follow the steps below to add a device: ① Click "Refresh" to enforce auto-discovery of devices. ② Enter the "Device ID" to verify that the router is original/valid. The "Device ID" can be found on the back of the router.

2) Manually add If you are unable to use the Auto Discovery feature, you can manually add the device. Check the label on the back of the router for the device ID, MAC address, and S/N.

3) Bulk import For those who need to add multiple devices at once, you can use the Bulk Import feature.

docs.title: 7. Check Devices Information and Status
docs.text:
Users can access the list of their devices on the left side under the 'Devices' section.

  • Batch Operations：

  • To view and edit device information and usage, click on the name of each device in the list. This will take you to the device details page. The middle tab bar on this page allows you to switch between different data of device usage, such as router overview, client list, timeline, sharing, and signal strength.

  • For IoT devices, you can view the following configuration information:

    • Bluetooth Configuration: Check the device's Bluetooth settings, including pairing status, Bluetooth version, connected devices, and Bluetooth signal strength.

    • Thread Configuration: View the device's Thread network settings, including network status, node role, connection status, and network name.

    • Please visit this website (https://docs.gl-inet.com/iot/en/thread_board_router/gl-s200/bluetooth/) for more information.

docs.title: 8. Moving Devices to the Department
docs.text:
Select the device on the right side of the page, and click the 'Manage' button to manage the device, including modifying device information, mobile grouping, mobile department, device sharing, and device deletion—five kinds of operations.

To move the device to the desired department/group, select the department/group in the pop-up window and click on 'Confirm'. This operation ensures that different devices can be managed separately by different departments and enables the integration of the same type of devices. (For information on moving groups, refer to section 9 below - 'Adding Devices to a Group').

Please note that members of each department can only view and operate devices under their own department without any special privilege assignment.

docs.title: 9. Create a Device Group
docs.text:
To create a device group, go to the Grouping page under the Organization View. The department tree is displayed on the left side of the page.

  • To create a group, select the department to which the group belongs from the list on the left and click on the 'Add' button.

  • In the pop-up window, enter the group name and check the device model and version. (You must add the device before you can create the group). Only one model and version of the device can be added to each group.

  • Once successfully added, the grouping will be displayed in the list on the right side of the page.

docs.title: 10. Adding Devices to a Group
docs.text:
To move devices to a device group, click on the left navigation bar to go to the Devices page. Select the devices you want to move to the device group and click on 'Manage' → 'Move Group'.

Next, select the target group in the popup window and click on 'Confirm'.

The number of devices in the corresponding group will increase. At this point, users can batch configure the devices in the device group, just like operating a single device.

docs.title: 11. Creating a template for the device settings
docs.text:
In the Organization view, click on the 'Settings Template' menu in the left navigation bar to access the page. The templates configured here can be used on the Devices and Groups pages.

  • The first step is to create a template. Click the 'Add' button to create a new template. In the pop-up window, set the template name, select the corresponding model and firmware version, and then click 'Next'.

  • In the 'Configuration' section on the left, select the relevant information to input, and then click 'Add'.

  • Preview the configuration details to be applied, and click 'OK' or 'Apply'.

docs.title: 12. Apply the Template
docs.text:
In the Organization view, switch to the Group/Device page using the left navigation bar. Locate the group or device you want to configure, and select it. Then, click on 'Settings' → 'Apply Template'.

Next, in the pop-up window, select the template you have just configured and click 'Apply'.

If you don't need to adjust the template, you can directly click the 'Apply' button to modify the device settings.

To apply additional settings based on an existing template, click the 'Customize' button.

docs.title: 13. Manage Devices
docs.text: Devices can be operated based on various customer requirements. Click on the 'Settings' operation button to modify the configuration and apply template operations.

docs.title: 13.1 Modify the Configuration
docs.text:
① Select the configuration name you want to modify from the left menu bar.

② Input and select the specific parameters.

③ Click 'Apply'.

④ Review the new settings on the preview screen.

⑤ Click the 'Confirm' button to issue and apply the configuration.

docs.title: 13.2 Share devices
docs.text:
You can choose to share a device, granting the recipient full control over it. Please exercise caution when performing this action.

By default, the device will be shared with an individual user, and you also have the option to set an expiration date for the sharing if needed.

If the device experiences any issues, you can opt to share it with GL.iNet Technical Support along with some basic information. Our team will get in touch with you promptly to provide technical assistance.

You can view and manage your device sharing settings from the device details page at any time.

docs.title: 13.3 Upgrade devices
docs.text:
① Set the execution status and select the execution time.

② Click 'Next' to create the upgrade task.

docs.title: 13.4 Device Control Operation
docs.text: Interact with the router's Admin management panel to achieve cloud control over the router.

docs.title: 14. Adding a Device Alert Rule
docs.text:
For Business users, effective management of both SIM card data usage and network connections is crucial for maintaining seamless operations and controlling costs.

When a device's SIM card data usage approaches or exceeds a set threshold, or when the primary network link fails and switches to a backup, the system immediately notifies users.

These real-time notifications help avoid unexpected overages, prevent service disruptions, and ensure business continuity.

With enhanced monitoring across diverse business scenarios, the cloud platform empowers users to proactively manage device performance and maintain operational control.

docs.title: 14.1 Managing Notification Rules
docs.text: Log into the GoodCloud platform. Navigate to the Notifications page from the main menu. Here, you can manage all alert rules, including adding, deleting, or modifying them.

docs.title: 14.2 Adding a Notification Rule
docs.text:
To create an alert rule, click the Add button on the Notifications page and follow these four steps:

1) Select Monitoring Device.

2) Set Trigger Event.

3) Specify Recipients.

4) Review Rule Settings.

docs.title: 14.2.1 Select Monitoring Device
docs.text:
Select Devices or Groups for which you want to create the rule.

  • To select specific devices, use the fuzzy search by Device Name；

  • The "Select All" option excludes devices from sub-departments; you can switch departments to select multiple monitoring targets.

docs.title: 14.2.2 Set Trigger Event
docs.text:
Set the Monitoring Criteria (e.g., SIM card data usage threshold, main link status).

  • You can switch event types to configure the monitoring parameters for the devices.

docs.title: 14.2.3 Specify Recipients
docs.text:
Choose the Recipients who will receive notifications (via email or internal message).

  • The "Select All" option for recipients excludes members from sub-departments; you can switch departments to select multiple recipients.

docs.title: 14.2.4 Check Rule Settings
docs.text:
You must first set the importance level for the alert rule. Once confirmed, apply the rule to activate monitoring.

  • The importance level set will apply to each trigger event within the rule, affecting notification methods and display on the page.

docs.title: 14.2.5 Feature Highlights
docs.text:
• The prompt displays the count of selected devices and device groups for your reference.

  • When monitoring alerts for a device group, any new device added will automatically sync existing alert rules for that group.

  • Certain alert rules can incorporate a debounce mechanism to prevent frequent alerts due to network or device issues, ensuring important messages aren't overlooked;

    • For example, with a 60-second Prevent Repeated Trigger mechanism, if a device goes offline and comes back online within 60 seconds, the alert rule won't trigger, and no internal messages or email notifications will be sent.

  • To modify previously set content, you have three options:

- Click the steps bar at the top of the page；

- Click the edit button next to the preview content；

- Click the Previous button at the bottom right of the page；

docs.title: 14.3 Editing / Deleting Notification Rules
docs.text:
Step 1: On the Notifications page, view all existing notification rules. Use fuzzy search with Trigger Event, Device Name, Device Model, Description, and Recipients to quickly locate alert rules.

Step 2: Click on any rule to edit or delete it.

Step 3: Modify the devices, monitoring criteria, or recipients as needed, and save changes.

docs.title: 14.4 Receiving and Viewing Notifications
docs.text: When a device triggers a notification rule, notifications will be sent via Email or Internal Message.

docs.title: 14.4.1 Message Notification Reception
docs.text:
• Email
  • Internal Messages
  • Message Box

Alert information will be pinned in the message box, displaying only the five most recent unread messages. Click "View All" to see all unread messages.

docs.title: 14.4.2 Accessing the Message Center for More Messages
docs.text:
Internal messages can be viewed in the Message Center, where you can manage, acknowledge, or dismiss them.

Quickly filter by message type, level, reception time, and read/unread status for historical tracking.

docs.title: 14.4.3 Customizing Message Reception Settings
docs.text:
Quickly filter by message type, level, reception time, and read/unread status for historical tracking.

  • Customize how users receive messages (internal messages/email) based on message categories, allowing selection of message types;

  • Each message type is divided into levels (aligned with alert rule settings), allowing different notification methods for the same message type.

docs.title: 15. Site-to-Site
docs.text:
In the Organization view, click the 'Site-to-Site' menu in the left navigation bar to access the page where you can create and manage network connections.

For detailed instructions, please refer to the Site to Site.

docs.title: 16. Brand Customization
docs.text: For White Label businesses, please refer to the WhiteLabel Domain for details on customizing your domain name. If you require assistance, please contact us directly.

docs.title: 17. Organizational settings
docs.text: In the Organization view, click Settings in the left navigation bar to access the page where you can view security authentication and package information. Users and roles with permission to modify the organization's name can do so quickly from this page.

docs.title: 18.API Integrations
docs.text:
The Platform API is a RESTful interface that provides programmatic access to much of the data and actions in the system.

To ensure the security of user data, users must create a token on the platform and manually submit it to the third-party integration system.

To ensure the quality of interface data transmission and to provide clearer access to interface call records, we strongly recommend that users generate a token for each integration system they need to avoid token reuse.

Please visit this website API Integrations for more information on API integration.

docs.title: 19. Viewing Logs
docs.text:
• Activity Logs

  • Upgrade Logs

  • Device Settings Logs

docs.title: 1. Organization and cooperation management
docs.text:
Business background: VARs are responsible for device distribution and organization management.

They can create and manage organizations and add members but cannot manage departments or devices directly. Devices are managed only after being transferred to the organization.

VAR administrators must create roles for device import/export operations and invite their employees for platform management.

docs.title: 1.1. Creating or Modifying VAR Roles
docs.text:
• When you enter the Role Management page, it will display the VAR Role Add and Edit page by default. To add a new role, click the Add a New Role button in the list. To modify an existing role, select the role you want to change and click Edit in the lower right corner. This action will open the role editing interface.

    ① Change Role Name: At the top right of the page, you can edit the role name.

    ② Set Role Privileges: In the right area, all functional modules of the VAR role are listed. You can control the corresponding operation privileges by toggling the buttons. Note that all functional modules must first have View privileges before other operational privileges can be adjusted.

  • To batch allow or disallow privileges, use the Allow All or Disable All buttons in the upper right corner.

  • After configuring the role, click the Apply button. The system will return to the role configuration page, and the new role will be created successfully.

docs.title: 1.2. Inviting Members to Join the VAR
docs.text:
Access the Members Page: Click on 'Members' in the left navigation bar. This page displays a list of members. VAR members are typically VAR employees responsible for managing transfers, configuring, and commissioning devices.

Invite a Member: Click the 'Invite' button at the top of the list. The invitation process consists of two steps:

  • Step 1: Enter Invitation Details

    • Enter the email address or username of the user you want to invite in the pop-up window.

      • For Unregistered Emails: If the email is not registered, a pop-up will ask if you want to invite the user to register. Click 'Confirm' and 'Apply' to send an invitation email. The user must click the link in the email to register and be added to the VAR.

      • For Registered Emails: If the email is already registered, the system will display the user’s information.

    • Set the expiration date for the invitation (default is one hour; can range from one hour to 180 days).

    • Click 'Next'.

  • Step 2: Assign Roles and Permissions

    • Select the VAR role for this member in the next pop-up window. The role determines what the member can do with devices and data.

    • Choose the level of access:

      • 'None': No access to VAR subordinate organizations.

      • 'Partial Organizations': Allows configuration of specific organizations. Click '+ Add' to select the organizations the member can access and configure corresponding permissions.

        • After selecting the organizations, click 'Next' to return to the 'Member Settings' page.

        • Click 'Apply' to finalize the access settings.

      • 'All Organizations': If this option is selected, the invited employee will be granted access to all organizations under the VAR. Configure the unified permission roles and set a deadline for the employee’s access.

        • Please note that once this option is successfully configured, any new organization added by the VAR will automatically grant the employee the relevant rights based on the role permissions set at that time.

  • After configuring the access rights for this member, click the 'Apply' button to complete the invitation. This setup is typically used for VAR technical support staff, allowing them to access customer data and devices, and collaborate with customers to configure the devices.

Other Actions:

Invited members are listed on the right side of the page, with an "Unregistered" or "Unaccepted" status label next to their usernames. Once they complete the registration or authorization process by clicking the link in the email, their status will update accordingly. If a user accidentally deletes the email or clicks "Decline," you can select the member from the list and click "Re-Invite" to resend the invitation.

To modify the VAR Roles for an invited member or adjust their roles related to VAR-affiliated organizations, click "Modify."

docs.title: 2. VAR Devices Transfer Process (To Business Users)
docs.text:
Business Background: After users purchase devices from a distributor (VAR), the distributor typically creates a separate organization for each member.

For example, if Google buys routers from CSG, CSG will create an organization in GoodCloud named "Google Inc." The inventory is then allocated to the organization created by the distributor.

docs.title: 2.1. Creating an Organization in the VAR
docs.text:
• Access the Organization Page:

    • Click on 'Organizations' in the left navigation bar. The page will display a list of organizations created by this VAR, including basic details such as the organization's name, administrator, and number of devices. Note that devices and data in each organization are not interoperable.

  • Add a New Organization:

    • Click on the '+ Add' button. In the dialog box that appears, enter the name of the user's organization and click 'Next'.

  • Set Up an Administrator:

    • On the next page, enter the email address or username of the organization's administrator. The administrator should be a customer of the VAR, not an employee of the VAR. Set the expiration date for the invitation and click 'Next'.

  • Handle User Registration:

    • Depending on the user information entered:

      • If the email address is not registered: A prompt will ask if you want to invite the user to register. Click 'Confirm' and 'Apply'. The system will send an email to the user. They will join the organization after clicking the link in the email and completing the registration.

      • If the email address or username is already registered: The user information will be displayed. Click 'Apply'.

  • Complete the Organization Creation:

    • After successful creation, the new organization will appear in the list. As the VAR owner, you can select the organization and click 'Access' to enter the organization's view and manage it.

docs.title: 2.2. Transfer devices
docs.text:
• Filter and Search for Devices:

    • Use the search function in the upper right corner and advanced search options to locate the desired device.

      ① Fuzzy Matching: Device ID, MAC, SN, storage warehouse, and order number; Advanced Search: Allows logical customized matching.

      ② Selection: Choose matching conditions (all or any).

      ③ Add Condition: Up to five conditions can be added.

      ④ Matching Logic: Comprises matching parameters, logical relationships, and search contents.

      ⑤ Apply: Results must satisfy all specified matching logic.

    • Searches are generally conducted in the following MAC filter form:

  • Transfer Devices:

    ① Select Devices: Choose the filtered devices.

    ② Click 'Transfer': Initiate the transfer process.

    ③ Select Customer Organization: Choose the organization to receive the devices from the pop-up window.

    ④ Apply: Complete the transfer.

  • View Outgoing Devices:

    • Switch to Organization View:

      • From Home Page: Click on Online Devices, Offline Devices, Inactive Devices, or Total Devices to view.

      • Navigation Bar: Go to the 'Devices' menu on the left.

Note: Organizations created under the VAR cannot add devices on their own. They can only receive and manage devices transferred by the VAR.

docs.title: 3. VAR Devices Transfer Process (To Individual Users)
docs.text:
Business Background: For individual users, the VAR creates a single organization with its administrators being VAR employees.

For instance, if a device is sold to an individual user, the device is transferred to this organization (e.g., Organization A) and pre-configured. The individual user then binds the device to the cloud platform upon receipt.

docs.title: 4. Configuring Device Brand Information (White Label of Firmware)
docs.text: Business Background: Since the logo on the Admin Panel cannot be preset during production, white-label users need to configure the logo and other brand information through the firmware management Admin Panel on GoodCloud.

docs.title: 4.1. Modify Device Web-GUI Information
docs.text:
• In the VAR view, navigate to the Settings Template page.

  • Click on "Modify" at the top.

  • Toggle on "Enable Brand Settings Template" in the pop-up window. This will allow GoodCloud to automatically apply brand information (e.g., trademarks) to the firmware Admin Panel for all new devices that come online and belong to the VAR.

  • Enter the required information, including:

    • Domain name;

    • Company name;

    • Company website;

    • Logo;

    • Other relevant details.

  • Click "Confirm" to save the configuration.

  • Once configured, the top card will indicate that the brand configuration template is enabled. In this state, organizations under the VAR will not be able to configure their own brand information.

docs.title: 5. Configuring GoodCloud Brand Information (White Label of GoodCloud)
docs.text: Business background: For White Label business only. Custom domain name configuration details can be found in the https://static.goodcloud.xyz/docs/WhiteLabel_Domain.pdf. Contact us if you need further assistance.

docs.title: 5.1. Modify Cloud Platform Interface Information
docs.text:
Steps:

  • Review the White Label Domain Guide for detailed instructions on customizing your domain name.

  • Contact GoodCloud support if you require assistance with configuring your White Label brand information or have specific needs related to the branding process.

  • Follow the provided guide to set up your domain name and other brand details as required for your White Label setup.

docs.title: 2.Join the VAR
docs.text:
• Invitation and Registration:

    • When adding a user as a VAR administrator or member, an email invitation will be sent if the user has not yet registered for a GoodCloud account.

      • The user clicks the link in the email to register, and they will be automatically added to the VAR.

    • Sign Up:

      • Visit GoodCloud to sign up and sign in.

      • If you don't find the verification email, check your spam folder or try again later. For sign-up issues, email b2bsupport@gl-inet.com for assistance.

  • For Registered Users:

    • Method 1: An invitation email is sent to the user’s registered email address. Clicking the link will add them to the VAR and redirect them to the VAR’s view.

    • Method 2: When logged into GoodCloud, a reminder will pop up. Clicking "Accept" will add them to the VAR and redirect them to the VAR’s view.

  • View Status and Switching:

    • Users can view their current status in the upper right corner and switch between the VAR view, Organization view, and Self-view.

    • Note: Devices and data are not interoperable between individual accounts and VAR accounts.

  • Home Page Overview:

    • View metrics such as devices in stock, returned devices, total devices, online devices, offline devices, inactive devices, out-of-stock devices, and subordinate organizations.

    • Click on these metrics for quick access to detailed views.

docs.title: 3. Creating an Organization in the VAR
docs.text:
• Accessing the Organizations Page:

    • Click on 'Organizations' in the left navigation bar to view a list of organizations under this VAR, including details about the organization, its administrator, and the number of devices. Note that devices and data are not interoperable between different organizations under the VAR.

  • Adding a New Organization:

    • Click the '+ Add' button to start creating a new organization.

    • Enter the name of the organization in the dialog box and click 'Next'.

  • Setting Up an Administrator:

    • On the next page, set up an administrator for the organization. The administrator should be a customer of the VAR, not a VAR employee.

    • Enter the user’s email or username and specify the expiration date for the invitation. Click 'Next'.

  • Handling User Information:

    • If the email is not registered:

      • A prompt will ask if you want to invite the user to register. Click 'Confirm' and 'Apply' to send an invitation email. The user will register through the link in the email and join the organization upon successful registration.

    • If the email or username is already registered:

      • The system will display the existing user information. Simply click 'Apply'.

  • Completing the Creation:

    • Once the organization is successfully created, it will appear in the list. As the VAR owner, you can select the organization and click 'Access' to manage it.

docs.title: 4. Creating and Modifying VAR & Organization Roles
docs.text:
• Accessing Role Management:

    • In the left navigation bar, click on 'Role' Management to enter the page.

docs.title: 4.1. Creating or modifying the VAR roles
docs.text:
• Accessing the VAR Roles Page:

    • When you enter the Role Management page, it defaults to the VAR Role Add and Edit page.

  • Creating a New VAR Role:

    • Click the 'Add a New Role' button in the list.

    • Enter the role name at the top right of the page.

    • Configure the role by setting operational privileges for the functional modules listed on the right.

    • View Privileges: All functional modules must first have View privileges enabled before configuring other privileges.

    • Click "Allow All" or "Disable All" in the upper right corner to batch allow or disallow privileges.

    • Click 'Apply' to save and create the new role.

  • Modifying an Existing VAR Role:

    • Select a role you want to modify from the list.

    • Click 'Edit' in the lower right corner to enter the role editing mode.

    • Adjust the role name and permissions as needed.

    • Click 'Apply' to save changes.

docs.title: 4.2. Creating or modifying the organization roles
docs.text:
• Accessing the Organization Roles Page:

    • Click 'Organizational Roles' in the upper tab bar to manage roles specific to organizations.

    • Creating or Modifying Organization Roles:

    • Add and edit organization roles using the same method described in 3.1 for VAR roles.

    • Note: The organization roles created by the VAR are synchronized to the VAR's organization. Subordinate organizations cannot delete or edit these VAR-created roles.

docs.title: 5. Inviting members to join the VAR
docs.text:
Access the Members Page: Click on 'Members' in the left navigation bar. This page displays a list of members. VAR members are typically VAR employees responsible for managing transfers, configuring, and commissioning devices.

Invite a Member: Click the 'Invite' button at the top of the list. The invitation process consists of two steps:

  • Step 1: Enter Invitation Details

    • Enter the email address or username of the user you want to invite in the pop-up window.

      • For Unregistered Emails: If the email is not registered, a pop-up will ask if you want to invite the user to register. Click 'Confirm' and 'Apply' to send an invitation email. The user must click the link in the email to register and be added to the VAR.

      • For Registered Emails: If the email is already registered, the system will display the user’s information.

    • Set the expiration date for the invitation (default is one hour; can range from one hour to 180 days).

    • Click 'Next'.

  • Step 2: Assign Roles and Permissions

    • Select the VAR role for this member in the next pop-up window. The role determines what the member can do with devices and data.

    • Choose the level of access:

      • 'None': No access to VAR subordinate organizations.

      • 'Partial Organizations': Allows configuration of specific organizations. Click '+ Add' to select the organizations the member can access and configure corresponding permissions.

        • After selecting the organizations, click 'Next' to return to the 'Member Settings' page.

        • Click 'Apply' to finalize the access settings.

      • 'All Organizations': If this option is selected, the invited employee will be granted access to all organizations under the VAR. Configure the unified permission roles and set a deadline for the employee’s access.

        • Please note that once this option is successfully configured, any new organization added by the VAR will automatically grant the employee the relevant rights based on the role permissions set at that time.

  • After configuring the access rights for this member, click the 'Apply' button to complete the invitation. This setup is typically used for VAR technical support staff, allowing them to access customer data and devices, and collaborate with customers to configure the devices.

Other Actions: Invited members are listed on the right side of the page, with an "Unregistered" or "Unaccepted" status label next to their usernames.

Once they complete the registration or authorization process by clicking the link in the email, their status will update accordingly.

If a user accidentally deletes the email or clicks "Decline," you can select the member from the list and click "Re-Invite" to resend the invitation.

To modify the VAR Roles for an invited member or adjust their roles related to VAR-affiliated organizations, click "Modify."

docs.title: 6. Adding Devices
docs.text:
To add devices directly to the customer's VAR account, follow these steps:

  • Access the Device Inventory Page:

    • Click 'Devices' in the left navigation bar.

    • Select 'Inventory' to enter the inventory page.

  • Add New Devices:

    • Click the '+ Add' button.

    • Enter the device information in the popup window.

    • Note: This process is the same as the one described in "For Organizational Customers - 6 Adding Devices."

docs.title: 7. Classifying Devices in the Warehouse
docs.text:
To classify devices in the warehouse:

  • Select Devices:

    • Choose the devices you want to classify.

  • Edit Device Information:

    • Click on the 'Edit' button.

  • Add Categorization Tags:

    • Enter categorized information (tags) via the keyboard.

    • Confirm the tags by pressing the Enter key.

Note: Proper tagging facilitates easier device transfer and management.

docs.title: 8.Transferring Devices
docs.text:
• Filter Devices:

    • Use the search function in the upper right corner and advanced search options to find the desired devices.

      ① Fuzzy matching can be performed for device ID, MAC, SN, storage warehouse, and order number, and logical customized matching can also be achieved through advanced search;

      ② Select the matching conditions (all or any);

      ③ Add condition: A maximum of five items can be added;

      ④ The matching logic is divided into 3 parts, which are matching parameters, logical relationships, and search contents;

      ⑤ After clicking Apply, the matching result of the final device needs to satisfy all the matching logic.

    Searches are generally conducted in the following MAC filter form:

  • Transfer Devices:

    ①Select Devices: Choose the filtered devices.

    ② Click Transfer: Click the 'Transfer' button.

    ③ Select Organization: Choose the customer organization to receive the devices in the pop-up window.

    ④ Apply: Confirm the transfer.

  • View Outgoing Devices:

    • Switch to Organization View:

    • From the Home Page: Click on Online Devices, Offline Devices, Inactive Devices, or Total Devices.

    • Through Navigation: Use the 'Devices' menu on the left side of the navigation bar to jump to device pages.

      • Note: Organizations created under the VAR cannot add devices on their own; they can only receive devices transferred by the VAR.

docs.title: 9. Returning Devices (Organization Member Operation)
docs.text:
For a Deivce that has been shipped out to an organization and needs to be returned if there is a hardware failure, you can perform a return operation in the corresponding organization view of the VAR.

  • Access Organization View:

    • Enter the subordinate organization view.

    • Click the 'Devices' menu on the left navigation bar.

  • Initiate Return Process:

    • Select the devices to be returned under the department.

    • Click 'Manage' and then 'Return Devices' to start the return process.

  • Complete Return Details:

    • Fill in the reason for the return.

    • Confirm the basic information of the devices to be returned twice.

    • Click 'Confirm' to complete the return.

  • Return Confirmation:

    • The system will confirm that the return is successful.

    • Retain the return order number for future reference, which will be used by the VAR for inventory or deletion operations of the returned devices.

docs.title: 10. Returned Devices Processing (VAR Member Operation)
docs.text:
• Alert for Returned Devices:

    • The VAR will receive a notification when a device is returned.

  • View Returned Devices:

    • Go to Devices → Returning to view the list of returned devices.

  • Process Returned Devices:

    • Inventory:

      • If the device is not faulty and should be returned to the warehouse, select the device and click 'Inbound'.

    • Edit the returned device information if needed for future inventory management.

    • Delete:

      • If the device is damaged or defective and needs to be returned to GL.iNet or discarded, select the device and click 'Delete'.

docs.title: 11. Creating Template settings
docs.text:
The templates configured here can be used in the subordinate organization views 'Devices' and 'Groups' pages;

  • Access Template Configuration:

    • In the VAR view, click on the 'Template Configuration' menu in the left navigation bar.

  • Create a New Template:

    • Click the 'Add' button to start creating a new template.

    • In the pop-up window, set the template name, select the corresponding model and firmware version, and click Next.

  • Configure Template Information:

    • Enter the required configuration details and click Next.

  • Preview and Apply:

    • Review the configuration information.

    • Click Apply to finalize and create the template.

  • Manage Templates:

    • You can edit, clone, delete, and synchronize templates in the template list.

    • Edit: Modify existing templates.

    • Clone: Create a copy of a template.

    • Delete: Remove a template from the list.

    • Synchronize: Sync templates to the subordinate organization's template configuration list.

docs.title: 12. Template Pre-Configuration
docs.text:
• Access Brand Configuration Template:

    • In the VAR view, click the 'Modify' button to adjust the branding setup template. This template will be applied to uninitialized devices (including new or reset devices) when they come online in any organization.

  • Pre-Configuration Process:

    ① Click 'Modify': Access the brand configuration template settings.

    ② Enable Template Switch: Toggle the switch to enable the brand configuration template.

    ③ Output Configuration Information: Enter and review the branding information.

    ④ Confirm Configuration: Verify and confirm the configuration content.

docs.title: 13. Apply the template
docs.text:
• Navigate to Group/Device Page:

    • Enter the organization view under VAR.

    • Click the left navigation bar to switch to the Group/Device page.

  • Apply the Template:

    • Find and select the group you want to configure.

    • Click Settings → Apply Template.

    • In the pop-up window, select the template you configured and click Apply.

    • The log of the device settings will reflect the applied template.

docs.title: 14. Brand customization
docs.text:
Business background: For White Label business only. Custom domain name configuration details can be found in the WhiteLabel Domain. Contact us if you need further assistance.

Steps:

  • Review the White Label Domain Guide for detailed instructions on customizing your domain name.

  • Contact GoodCloud support if you require assistance with configuring your White Label brand information or have specific needs related to the branding process.

  • Follow the provided guide to set up your domain name and other brand details as required for your White Label setup.

docs.title: 15. VAR Information
docs.text:
• View Distributor Information:

    • In the VAR view, click Distributor Information in the left navigation bar.

    • View security authentication and package information.

  • Modify Distributor Name:

    • Users with permission can quickly modify the distributor name.

docs.title: 16. API Integrations
docs.text:
The Platform API is a RESTful interface that provides programmatic access to much of the data and actions in the system.

To ensure the security of user data, users must create a token on the platform and manually submit it to the third-party integration system.

To ensure the quality of interface data transmission and to provide clearer access to interface call records, we strongly recommend that users generate a token for each integration system they need to avoid token reuse.

Please visit this website API Integrations for more information on API integration.

docs.title: 17. Viewing Logs
docs.text: • Activity Logs

docs.title: 18. Sending Messages to Subordinate Organizations
docs.text: You can edit and customize internal messages and emails. You can also select specific organizations and users, and send emails from a brand-customized address.
